ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned new assays depending on the type of experiment I'd want to conduct. Learned the mechanisms/processes of RNA transcription and translation to protein. Gained skills in reading and discussing papers. Gained skills in developing research proposal and the processes involved in creating them. Gained skill in being able to problem solve and think of a next step.

I think this course was very helpful in developing an in-depth understanding of eukaryotic molecular biology. Midway through the term I was able to integrate material that I learned from other courses as well.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: Gain a lot of critical thinking skills when discussing science and experiments. Instructors extremely knowledgeable and helpful.

Weakness: Could bring up project earlier in the semester than a week before titles are due. Would allow for students to start thinking earlier about the project since the reminder in class is typically when they start to think about it.

Weakness: Sometimes the discussion papers weren't posted with enough time to prepare. The proposal assignment should be brought up in class more before it is due. This year (2023) we were given the last head's up about the paper ~2 weeks before. Perhaps 10-15 min discussion about what is expected would be useful for students.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Maybe audit though because the exams can be a lot. But the project and discussion sections are helpful.

I highly recommend this course to other students. The workload can be a lot, but I think we came out as better scientists in the end. It has become much easier for me to integrate knowledge from other fields now that I have taken Euks.
